metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2226 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the string_appends function in cplus-dem.c in libiberty allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted executable, which triggers a buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-2226` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.28-3ubuntu1
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.28-3ubuntu1
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.28-3ubuntu1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.28-3ubuntu1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.28-3ubuntu1
binutils-common - 2.28-3ubuntu1
binutils-for-build - 2.28-3ubuntu1
binutils-for-host - 2.28-3ubuntu1
binutils-hppa-linux-gnu - 2.28-3ubuntu1
binutils-hppa64-linux-gnu - 2.28-3ubuntu1
binutils-i686-gnu - 2.28-3ubuntu1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: binutils package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.28-3ubuntu1').
binutils-h8300-hms package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
gcc-h8300-hms package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
gdb package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.99.90.20170502-0ubuntu1').
